paper_title.en: Effects of divalent cations on Halobacterium salinarum cell aggregation

description.en: Ca2+ was found to be essential for initiating Halobacterium salinarum CCM 2090 cell aggregation. The floe formed from such aggregation could easily be dissociated without cellular lysis by sodium citrate. Cr2+, Mn2+, Fe3+, CO2+, Ni2+, CU2+, and Zn2+ could replace Ca2+. However, Mg2+, Sr2+, Mo2+, Cd2+, Sn2+, Hg2+, and Pb2+ induced no flocculation of cells of this halophilic archaeon. Mg2+ acted antagonistically against Ca2+-induced aggregation. Such aggregation might be directly caused by the interaction of Ca2+ and aggregation factors from 55 degrees C-treated cell extract.

paper_title.en: Effects of divalent cations on Halobacterium salinarum cell aggregation

description.en: Ca2+ was found to be essential for initiating Halobacterium salinarum CCM 2090 cell aggregation. The floe formed from such aggregation could easily be dissociated without cellular lysis by sodium citrate. Cr2+, Mn2+, Fe3+, CO2+, Ni2+, CU2+, and Zn2+ could replace Ca2+. However, Mg2+, Sr2+, Mo2+, Cd2+, Sn2+, Hg2+, and Pb2+ induced no flocculation of cells of this halophilic archaeon. Mg2+ acted antagonistically against Ca2+-induced aggregation. Such aggregation might be directly caused by the interaction of Ca2+ and aggregation factors from 55 degrees C-treated cell extract.

paper_title.en: Seasonal variation in biomass and photosynthetic activity of epilithic algae on a rock at the upper littoral area in the north basin of Lake Biwa, Japan

description.en: Vertical distributions of biomass and the photosynthetic activity of epilithic algae were observed seasonally with regard to their physical and chemical parameters along a rocky shoreline of the upper littoral area in the north basin of Lake Biwa. Chlorophyll a amounts in epilithic algae showed a marked change with depth from spring to early summer. The algal biomass showed higher values on the lower part of a large rock in early spring, and gradually increased on the upper part as a result of the growth of Spirogyra sp., a filamentous Chlorophyceae. This growth seems to be associated with a rise in water temperature, with the biomass at the upper depths seeming to be affected by a hydraulic disturbance. The standing crop of epilithic algae showed a maximum value in June and declined to a minimum in August because of the corresponding proliferation or disappearance of Spirogyra as well as changes in the water level. The maximum value of the assimilation number calculated from the potential photosynthetic rate of epilithic algae was obtained at the lower depths in June when Spirogyra grew vigorously. Appreciably high assimilation numbers were also observed in summer and fall, although chlorophyll a amounts were low. The present study is the first in a series to clarify the contribution of epilithic algae on rocky areas to productivity throughout the entire littoral ecosystem.

description.en: Vertical distributions of biomass and the photosynthetic activity of epilithic algae were observed seasonally with regard to their physical and chemical parameters along a rocky shoreline of the upper littoral area in the north basin of Lake Biwa. Chlorophyll a amounts in epilithic algae showed a marked change with depth from spring to early summer. The algal biomass showed higher values on the lower part of a large rock in early spring, and gradually increased on the upper part as a result of the growth of Spirogyra sp., a filamentous Chlorophyceae. This growth seems to be associated with a rise in water temperature, with the biomass at the upper depths seeming to be affected by a hydraulic disturbance. Appreciably high assimilation numbers were also observed in summer and fall, although chlorophyll a amounts were low. paper_title.en: Ca2+-dependent cell aggregation of halophilic archaeon, Halobacterium salinarum

description.en: Halobacterium salinarum CCM 2090 exhibits a Ca2+-dependent cellular aggregation system. This process is caused by the interaction between Ca2+ and aggregation factor(s). Although the aggregates formed are encased in matrix-like substances, such as bacterial biofilms, they are not attached to the abiotic substratum. Therefore, these substances may be distinguished from typical biofilms.

paper_title.en: Ca2+-dependent cell aggregation of halophilic archaeon, Halobacterium salinarum

paper_title.ja: The formation of cell aggregates in response to heat shock in Halobacterium halobium
paper_title.en: The Formation of Cell Aggregates in Response to Heat Shock in Halobacterium halobium

description.ja: Cells of the extremely halophilic archaea, Halobacterium halobium were allowed to form into multicellular aggregates, by shaking mid-log cells at 55℃ as a suspension in salts' medium. Although the functional substance(s) is unclear, the addition of complex medium repressed the aggregate formation. On the synthesis of macromolecular substances, the protein synthesis is significantly stimulated by aggregated cells, but in free cells, RNA synthesis is more active than protein synthesis. These differential responses to heat stress might be due to the differences of physiological states between aggregted cells and free cells.無機塩培地に懸濁した高度好塩性古細菌Halobacterium halobiumは55度処理で凝集体を形成した。この凝集体形成は複合培地の添加で抑えられた。凝集体形成細胞はタンパク質合成が,凝集体形成後に残存する遊離細胞ではRNA合成が盛んであった。この違いはこれら細胞群の生理的状態の違いを反映していると思われる。

paper_title.ja: Cellular protein profile of halophilic achaea, Halobacterium halobium CCM 2090. PartII. Protein synthesized cluring early stationary phase of cell growth
paper_title.en: Cellular Protein Profile of Halophilic Archaea, Halobacterium halobium CCM 2090 : Part II: Protein Synthesized during Early Stationary Phase of Cell Growth

description.ja: The cellular protein composition of Halobacterium halobium CCM2090, was analyzed by two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. The cells were labeled with [^(35)S] methionine by pulse-labeled method at early stationary phase of cell growth, and autoradiogram of the gel was analyzed by a recently described method involving a computer-coupled film scanning system. The 291 polypeptides detected in the autoradiogram. This analysis showed that the gel pattern of proteins remained similar to that reported previously using steady-state cells by silver staining. The 146 of them corresponded with those obtained from steady-state cells. The 145 polypeptides were newly detected. We presented the location of these polypeptides as a standard cellular protein profile of this bacterium.Halobacterium halobium CCM2090株の細胞構成蛋白質を2次元電気泳動法で調べた。定常期初期の細胞を[35S]メチオニンによるパルスラベル法で標識後, オートラジオグラムを作成し蛋白質を分析した。その結果291種の蛋白質が確認され, それらのゲルパターンはすでに報告した指数関数期後期細胞を構成する蛋白質のパターンと似ていた。291種の蛋白質の内145種は既報告の蛋白質種と一致し, 新たに145の蛋白質種が確認されたのでこれらについてもその位置を決定した。

paper_title.ja: Cellular protein profile of Halophilic avchaea, Halobacterium halobium.
paper_title.en: Cellular Protein Profile of Halophilic Archaea, Halobacterium halobium

description.ja: The cellular protein composition of Halobacterium halobium CCM2090 was investigated by two-imensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Cells were harvested within the late-logarithmic growth phase at 40℃ on basal salts' medium containing 10% Sehal and Gibbon's complex medium(V/V). The 244 polypeptides were separated from whole cell extract by electrophoresis. We presented the location of these polypeptides as a standard cellular protein profile of this bacterium in this reportHalobacterium halobium CCM2090 株の細胞内蛋白質組成を2次元電気泳動法を用いて調べた。10%のSehalとGibbon の複合培地を含む無機塩培地により 40度で指数関数期末期まで培養した菌体を用い調整した細胞抽出液から2次元電気泳動法で244種の蛋白質を分離しその位置を決定した。
